form.current-chamber: IN THE SENATE OF THE UNITED STATES

action.action-desc: Mr. Kennedy introduced the following bill; which was read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce, Science, and Transportation

form.official-title: To amend the Communications Act of 1934 to prohibit Federal funding for the Corporation for Public Broadcasting, and for other purposes.

section.text: This Act may be cited as the No Propaganda Act.

section.header: Prohibition on Federal funds for Corporation for Public Broadcasting

subsection.text: Section 396 of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396) is amended by adding at the end the following:
No Federal funds may be made available to the Corporation on or after the date of enactment of the No Propaganda Act.

subsection.header: Corporation prohibited from accepting Federal funds
subsection.text: Section 396(g) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396(g)) is amended—

paragraph.text: in paragraph (2)(A), by inserting subject to paragraph (3)(C), before obtain; and

subparagraph.text: in subparagraph (A), by striking ; and and inserting a semicolon;
in subparagraph (B), by striking the period at the end and inserting ; and; and
by adding at the end the following:
accepting funds from the Federal Government on or after the date of enactment of the No Propaganda Act.

subsection.text: Any unobligated balances of amounts made available under the heading Corporation for Public Broadcasting in the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2022 (Public Law 117–103; 136 Stat. 489), the Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2023 (Public Law 117–328; 136 Stat. 4901), or the Further Consolidated Appropriations Act, 2024 (Public Law 118–47; 138 Stat. 696) are rescinded.
Section 396(k)(3)(A)(iv)(II) of the Communications Act of 1934 (47 U.S.C. 396(k)(3)(A)(iv)(II)) is amended by inserting before the date of enactment of the No Propaganda Act after amounts received.
